A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Star Wars: The Last Jedi is not a very good movie and an awful Star Wars movie. After setting a serious tone with practical effects in The Force Awakens/Rogue One Disney decided that this movie needed more CGI and Guardians of the Galaxy comedy. Did you like the prequels? Well then maybe you'll like this. Anyone who cheered the first movie for getting the franchise "back on track" will be horrified. 

Ridiculous CGI animals with no purpose other than to be a stuffed animal sold to kids? Check. 
Extended dead end plotlines to give a character "something to do"? Check. 
Unsatisfying answers to Star Wars lore? Check. 
Main characters deliberately ignoring glaring facts or acting completely against their previously established nature just to bulldoze the plot forward? Check. 

Frankly\, I'm stunned that this has a 93% "Certified Fresh" rating from critics - did we watch the same movie? What's going on here?
